title: How do you feel about a 13% increase in Boston property taxes for homeowners this year?
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: Tell Us The bill has sparked controversy at local town halls.
Michelle Wu M.
Scott Brauer Mayor Michelle Wu’s third attempt to pass a tax relief bill for homeowners is being met with heated debate from residents.

title: Man charged for allegedly stealing from Hingham senior living complex
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Crime Kevaughn Fagan, 28, of Marshfield, allegedly posed as a rideshare driver and a junk removal employee to access the complex.
A Marshfield man has been charged for allegedly stealing from a Hingham senior living complex.

title: Lowell man now charged with murder in hit-and-run crash
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Crime Tito Nuth, 36, was arrested in October in connection with the August crash.
A Lowell man has now been indicted on a murder charge after a hit-and-run crash in August in the city left a 38-year-old man dead.

Tito Nuth, 36, was arraigned Tuesday in Middlesex Superior Court in Lowell on charges of murder and leaving the scene of personal injury or death, according to the Middlesex County District Attorney’s Office.

title: Westborough man convicted of murdering his mother in a hotel parking lot
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Crime A jury found Daniel Uhlman, 55, guilty of first-degree murder after an 11-day trial.
A Westborough man was convicted on Tuesday for the murder of his mother.
Following an 11-day trial, a jury found Daniel Uhlman, 55, guilty of first-degree murder and armed assault to murder a person over 60, according to the Middlesex County District Attorney’s Office.

title: Livestream: Judge to sentence Brian Walshe for wife Ana’s murder
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Crime Before Judge Diane Freniere imposes Walshe's sentences for all three charges, the court will hear victim impact statements.
Livestream via NBC10 Boston.
A Norfolk Superior Court judge will sentence Brian Walshe on Thursday for the murder of his wife, Ana Walshe, on New Year’s Day 2023 as the high-profile case reaches its final chapter.

title: American flags vandalized at South Boston memorials, sparking response from officials
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Crime Local veterans and elected officials held a meeting Wednesday at the Medal of Honor Park in response to the vandalism.
Three South Boston memorials with American flags were found vandalized Wednesday morning.
South Boston Community Bulletin Board Community members and elected officials are outraged after someone vandalized American flags at three memorials in South Boston.

title: Stefon Diggs admits to ‘adjusting’ to varying playing time with Patriots
